commit.message: Make " a word separator
Add missing include
Fix running with Qt 5.6
Use a 'solarized' palette

vte: add api to set a manual defined palette

This patch allow the libtsm user to set a manually defined palette
on the tsm_vte object. The new API takes the palette as uint8_t *
data, and an int passing the number of colors defined. If that number
is different from the current number of colors used in libts, setting
the palette will fail. This means that adding new colors in libtsm is
not backward compatible with manually defined palettes.
Don't quit when a shell exits
Fix scrolling with small delta values

Actually fix rendering when the cell has float size

This may seem a naive approach but it's the one that gives the
best results, and no drawback as far as i can see,
Fix rendering with floating cell sizes
Build the bundled libtsm as a static library
Merge commit '10cc62838899fa15769485c4945f0906fda48035' as 'libtsm'

Squashed 'libtsm/' content from commit b73acb4

git-subtree-dir: libtsm
git-subtree-split: b73acb4c71698a764763ae8dad94c1e8a2b8d7a3
Fix memory corruption when closing tabs
Fix selection when scrolling
Don't copy lines of spaces
Fix the cell mouse picking, for real.
Find the xkbcommon header. Thanks to anordal
Add libwayland's include path
Don't set empty selection
Don't crash when copying without a selection
Try again to fix mouse picking
Select a word with double click
Tweak the picking of the cell for some position
Fix pasting newlines
Fix copying spaces
Don't copy the selection data
Set the length of the copied buffer
Paste with ctrl+shift+v
Fix the alpha value of the background
Draw the top margin area with the background color
Use the arrow cursor over the borders
Allow changing the tab positions
Use the IBeam cursor
Better placement of the selection boundaries
Set the working directory to ~ at startup
Draw a black line around the window border
Have a 2 pixels margin at the top
Always attach a buffer when receiving the available geometry
Make the background a tiny bit more transparent
Implement copy support
Implement text paste
Use the orbital_dropdown_interface
Handle the function keys
Don't invoke a login shell
Use the id given by libtsm as the key for the glyphs cache
Close the window instead of quitting the application
Fix redraw while resizing
Set the window title
Initial commit.
Initial commit

issue_comments.body: Can you try building libtsm from git?
If you use it in Orbital pressing F12 should show it, otherwise it should show up as a normal window. You can also force it to be a normal window using the -w option.
Can you check if it is fixed now?
Almost! I still have to edit vte.cpp, but that's it.

This should fix the rest (works for me):

``` diff
 pkg_check_modules(libtsm libtsm REQUIRED)
 pkg_check_modules(wayland-client wayland-client REQUIRED)
+pkg_check_modules(xkbcommon xkbcommon REQUIRED)

 set(CMAKE_AUTOMOC ON)
 foreach(dir ${Qt5Gui_INCLUDE_DIRS})
     include_directories(${dir}/${Qt5Gui_VERSION_STRING}/QtGui/)
 endforeach(dir)
 include_directories(${wayland-client_INCLUDE_DIRS})
+include_directories(${xkbcommon_INCLUDE_DIRS})
```

According to my package manager (zypper), `pkg/libxkbcommon/xkbcommon/xkbcommon-keysyms.h` comes from the package `libxkbcommon-devel`. Hence the package name in the patch.
I don't get a window with the -w option either. (Not using Orbital, just plain weston.)
Ok, so with weston it should show a normal window even when not using -w. Can you paste here the output you get when exporting WAYLAND_DEBUG=1?

I get no output. The debug method works with other programs like weston-terminal and otter-browser.

What I get, is this process tree in htop. Termistor has got 2 process IDs. They are not using any CPU. Job control wise, termistor is running in the foreground.

```
weston-terminal
└─ fish
   └─ termistor
      └─ termistor
```
Well, that is weird. Are you sure you're using the wayland platform plugin? I.e. "termistor -platform wayland" or "export QT_QPA_PLATFORM=wayland".
That's it! I forgot -platform wayland. There was no error message because I was running X at the same time. You know what? Termistor works in X too!
